title: Events

content: Our first CTF Competition of the semester will be January 31st! Come celebrate completing the first month of 2024 with us by solving challenges and possibly winning Amazon gift cards! Make sure to RSVP with QR code above.

title: Month[0] CTF

content:
Blowfish has full support for Hugo taxonomies and will adapt to any taxonomy set up. Taxonomy listings like this one also support custom content to be displayed above the list of terms.
This area could be used to add some extra decriptive text to each taxonomy. Check out the advanced tag below to see how to take this concept even further.
summary: Blowfish has full support for Hugo taxonomies and will adapt to any taxonomy set up. Taxonomy listings like this one also support custom content to be displayed above the list of terms.
title: Tags

content:
Hi! We’re CTFC.
If you’re interested in hacking, cybersecurity, computers, or just like solving problems,
we have something for you! Open to ALL experience levels.
Our general meetings (GMs) are biweekly on Wednesdays from 6-7:30pm.
We also host two CTF competitions throughout the semester.
Come say hi and learn something new!
summary:

title: Welcome to CTFC!

content: Hi hackers! We‚Äôre back and better than ever! Join us this Wednesday 1/10 for a Clue inspired murder mystery challenge. We need your help in catching the killer here on NEU’s campus. Make friends, solve some puzzling CTF challenges, and find who the killer is‚Äî who knows, they might be closer than you think.
summary: Hi hackers! We‚Äôre back and better than ever! Join us this Wednesday 1/10 for a Clue inspired murder mystery challenge. We need your help in catching the killer here on NEU’s campus.
title: GM#1: Murder, Mystery, & CTFs

content: NU Security, NU WiCYS and NU CTF are so excited to announce the biggest student-led security event at Northeastern! We present to you: The SUB-Z3R0 CTF! This CTF is open to all undergraduate students who are interested, regardless of their experience level. Compete solo or with a team in engaging security challenges. Lunch will be provided, and winners can earn up to $75 in gift cards! Registration closes on November 28th, click the link in any of our Instagram bios to register today!
summary: NU Security, NU WiCYS and NU CTF are so excited to announce the biggest student-led security event at Northeastern! We present to you: The SUB-Z3R0 CTF! This CTF is open to all undergraduate students who are interested, regardless of their experience level.
title: Sub-Z3r0 CTF

content: Let‚Äôs get our hands deep into Wireshark ‚Äì your ‚Äúgateway‚Äù to understanding the intricacies of digital communication and much more. This is an advanced workshop but any and all questions are welcome! As we delve into the intricacies of Wireshark, the premier tool for network analysis, you’ll gain a mastery in network forensics.
summary: Let‚Äôs get our hands deep into Wireshark ‚Äì your ‚Äúgateway‚Äù to understanding the intricacies of digital communication and much more. This is an advanced workshop but any and all questions are welcome!
title: GM #8 Wireshark Pt. 2

content: Kali Linux, the de facto offensive security distribution, is a must-have for cybersecurity enthusiasts and we‚Äôre bringing it to you! Don‚Äôt worry about downloading anything beforehand, just bring yourself and your computer and we will take care of the rest. We will be introducing you to Kali Linux and a critical offensive security tool, SQLMap, known for its automation of SQL injection attacks. In the competitive cybersecurity job market, proficiency in security tools is a game-changer.
summary: Kali Linux, the de facto offensive security distribution, is a must-have for cybersecurity enthusiasts and we‚Äôre bringing it to you! Don‚Äôt worry about downloading anything beforehand, just bring yourself and your computer and we will take care of the rest.
title: GM #7: Kali Connect

content: We are nearing the end of Cybersecurity Awareness Month, that means we gotta finish strong! We had members saying the last CTF was too easy so we had to kick it up a notch. You all definitely felt the heat this time. We will be going over some of last week‚Äôs challenges and answer all of your burning questions. Come stop by for a good time!
summary: We are nearing the end of Cybersecurity Awareness Month, that means we gotta finish strong! We had members saying the last CTF was too easy so we had to kick it up a notch.
title: GM #6: Tricks and Treats

content:
Get ready for a spooktacular challenge!
It is Cybersecurity Awareness Month, this means more challenges to break into!
What’s in store for you:
Creepy cryptographic puzzles Haunted digital mazes Witchy riddles to solve Frighteningly fun challenges Prizes await the top 3 rankers, so assemble your team (max of 3) or go solo, and let the cryptic adventure begin!
1st Place: $25 gift Amazon gift card
2nd Place: $15 gift Amazon gift card
3rd Place: $10 gift Amazon gift card
Are you up for the challenge?

title: Sp00ky Scary CTF

content: Want to learn how to use this web pentesting tool and immediately apply your skills to solve CTF challenges? Come join us at our next GM with Burp Suite Community Edition installed!
summary: Want to learn how to use this web pentesting tool and immediately apply your skills to solve CTF challenges? Come join us at our next GM with Burp Suite Community Edition installed!
title: GM #5: Burp Suite Bash

content: Come explore a variety of CTF topics ranging from steganography to web exploitation and much more. This meeting is dedicated for you all to strengthen your weakest areas of expertise and sharpen your CTF experience through reinforcement.
summary: Come explore a variety of CTF topics ranging from steganography to web exploitation and much more. This meeting is dedicated for you all to strengthen your weakest areas of expertise and sharpen your CTF experience through reinforcement.
title: GM#4: Around the World

content:
Happy Cybersecurity Awareness Month hackers!
This means more challenges to conquer! Buckle up for this upcoming GM, whether you‚Äôll be tackling it individually or via teams, you will be going head-to-head in a treasure hunt. Join us as we will put your problem-solving and technical skills to the test! You may find some useful hints in our newsletter‚Ä¶ we will see you at the finish line!
summary:
Happy Cybersecurity Awareness Month hackers!
This means more challenges to conquer! Buckle up for this upcoming GM, whether you‚Äôll be tackling it individually or via teams, you will be going head-to-head in a treasure hunt.
title: GM #3: Cryptotrail

content: This week we‚Äôll be going over the challenges you loved from our Kickoff CTF competition. Bring all your burning questions and hopefully get inspired!
summary: This week we‚Äôll be going over the challenges you loved from our Kickoff CTF competition. Bring all your burning questions and hopefully get inspired!
title: GM #2: Walkthrough

content:
Thank you all for participating in our first ever CTF competition‚Äî it was special for us to see you all wracking your brain and enjoying the challenges we made.
This is just the beginning! We‚Äôll continue to make more fun and interesting challenges for you all to break into. We‚Äôll also have more enticing prizes… but you gotta earn it!
We hope to see you all next week as we‚Äôll be doing a walkthrough of the challenges.
Congratulations to the winners: Devin in 1st place, Owen in 2nd place and Ross in 3rd place!
Everyone working hard!
summary: Thank you all for participating in our first ever CTF competition‚Äî it was special for us to see you all wracking your brain and enjoying the challenges we made.
title: Kickoff CTF Competition

content: Cybersecurity resources and platforms to further practice your skills!
summary: Cybersecurity resources and platforms to further practice your skills!
title: Resources

content:
CTFC is an undergraduate student organization with a mission to create an inclusive and collaborative community of cybersecurity enthusiasts where members of all experience levels can learn hands-on, technical, offensive security skills through accessible workshops, trainings, and competitions.
Whether you’re a complete beginner or a seasoned expert, come hack with us!
2023 Eboard (and Founders!)
summary: CTFC is an undergraduate student organization with a mission to create an inclusive and collaborative community of cybersecurity enthusiasts where members of all experience levels can learn hands-on, technical, offensive security skills through accessible workshops, trainings, and competitions.
title: About Us

content:
This is the advanced tag. Just like other listing pages in Blowfish, you can add custom content to individual taxonomy terms and it will be displayed at the top of the term listing. üöÄ
You can also use these content pages to define Hugo metadata like titles and descriptions that will be used for SEO and other purposes.
summary: This is the advanced tag. Just like other listing pages in Blowfish, you can add custom content to individual taxonomy terms and it will be displayed at the top of the term listing.
